item.title: d a t green
item.description: Less than a year now to the end of this 2019 Parliament, by automatic operation of law.This means that the government has less than a year to get any new primary legislation through parliament, and with no scope for using Parliament Acts to defy the Lords.The end is in sight.

item.title: Frank Pasquale
item.description:
‚Äúthe same article, Insider revealed that Decentraland, arguably the largest and most relevant Metaverse platform, had only 38 active daily users. The Guardian reported that the monetized content ecosystem in Meta‚Äôs flagship product Horizon Worlds produced no more than $470 in revenue globally. You‚Äôre not reading those numbers wrong. To say that the Metaverse is dead is an understatement. It was never alive.‚Äù
https://www.thenation.com/article/culture/metaverse-zuckerberg-pr-hype/

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description: Fun fact that I just learned. I am a (multiple) scientific descendant of Hans-Lukas Teuber, the founder of our department at MIT (as well as a few other luminaries, lucky me).

item.title: Sheena Cruickshank
item.description: Excellent but stark from @chrischirp summarising where Uk data is in terms of Covid and flu. It‚Äôs not good, we are seeing more cases, there is reduced vaccine uptake in those eligible and many are now years from last booster. There really should be a surge vaccine campaign before NHS is overwhelmed https://open.substack.com/pub/christinapagel/p/england-in-biggest-covid-wave-in?r=11blfp&utm_medium=ios&utm_campaign=post

item.title: Manlio De Domenico
item.description:
üö®#ComplexityThoughts issue #22 is out: #ComplexSystems foundations #Neuroscience #MolecularBiology #Evolution #HumanBehaviorUnraveling complexity: building knowledge, one paper at a time!
Not yet subscribed? It's never too late, and it's 100% free.https://open.substack.com/pub/manlius/p/complexity-thoughts-issue-22?r=n4iyo&utm_campaign=post&utm_medium=web&showWelcome=true

item.title: Manlio De Domenico
item.description: It's nice to receive the support of many readers and to learn that some of them would be glad to pay for the #ComplexityThoughts newsletter. But I won't monetize with it, that was my decision from the very beginning. Knowledge should be shared and consumed freely.

item.title: Spencer LaVere Smith
item.description: Multiphoton imaging through 20 mm of air with the new Cousa objective. This is a new type of objective: ultra long working distance, huge field-of-view, optimized for two-photon imaging.And it fits on standard microscopes neuroscientists use for in vivo imaging (e.g., from Bruker, Thorlabs, Neurolabware, INSS, CoSys, etc.)!The Cousa provides excellent data and even three-photon imaging over a huge field-of-view!The paper has data from marmosets, tree shrews, both young and adult ferrets, intact pig eye, the first in vivo calcium imaging from mouse cochlear hair cells (!), beautiful input mapping / dendritic spine imaging, and more!The paper was published just now: https://doi.org/10.1038/s41592-023-02098-1 It's open access. The Cousa objective can be purchased from a company that is being spun out of the lab: https://pacificoptica.com
